qas.question: What river is a tributary of the River Thames?
What is the London Outer Orbital Path commonly referred as?
What walking path was created as a tribute to a member of the Royal Family who died prematurely?

answers.text: the Diana, Princess of Wales Memorial Walk

qas.question: Which walking path follows the route of the body of water for which it is named?
What recent improvements has served to enhance the walking experience?

context: Walking is a popular recreational activity in London. Areas that provide for walks include Wimbledon Common, Epping Forest, Hampton Court Park, Hampstead Heath, the eight Royal Parks, canals and disused railway tracks. <a4_0>Access to canals and rivers<a4_0/> has improved recently, including the creation of <a3_0>the Thames Path<a3_0/>, some 28 miles (45 km) of which is within Greater London, and The Wandle Trail; this runs 12 miles (19 km) through South London along <a0_0>the River Wandle<a0_0/>, a tributary of the River Thames. Other long distance paths, linking green spaces, have also been created, including the Capital Ring, the Green Chain Walk, London Outer Orbital Path (<a1_0>"Loop"<a1_0/>), Jubilee Walkway, Lea Valley Walk, and <a2_0>the Diana, Princess of Wales Memorial Walk<a2_0/>.
